alert.note: Alert for Charles; Prince Georges (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...ELEVATED THREAT FOR THE SPREAD OF WILDFIRES THROUGH THE EARLY EVENING... South to southwesterly winds continue to blow around 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 20 to 25 mph. Relative humidity values remain very low, generally running in the 15 to 25 percent range. Given the recent dry stretch, 10-hour fuel moistures have continued to dry out. With such conditions in place, a number of brush fires have broken out across the highlighted area. This region includes portions of the Shenandoah Valley eastward through much of northern and central Virginia into the Washington D.C. metro. The elevated fire danger will continue until 8 PM before the winds gradually begin to weaken. Outdoor burning is strongly discouraged during this time. Please refer to your local burn permitting authority on whether you can burn. If you do burn, use extreme caution and ensure fire suppression is readily available.
